what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal chromascope explore colours() find interesting set colours.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version chromascope like :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: chromascope provides functions extract colour data colours().
code: library(chromascope) #>  #> Attaching package: 'chromascope' #> The following object is masked from 'package:grDevices': #>  #>     col2rgb # Extract the hex code for the colour "red" col2hex("red") #> [1] "#FF0000" # Extract the hue, chroma, and luminance (hcl) data for the colour "red" col2hcl("red") #>            h       c        l #> [1,] 12.1744 179.049 53.24079 # Extract the red, green, and blue (rgb) data for the colour "red" col2rgb("red") #>        r g b #> [1,] 255 0 0 # Extract the hex code, hcl and rgb data for the colour "red". colour_data("red") #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>   name  hex       hue chroma luminance   red green  blue #>   <chr> <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl> <int> <int> <int> #> 1 red   #FF0000  12.2   179.      53.2   255     0     0

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)

what: Visualise the colours on specplot() and swatchplot()
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(colorspace) #> Warning: package 'colorspace' was built under R version 4.5.2  random_cols <- colour_data(random_cols)  swatchplot(random_cols$name) specplot(random_cols$hex) # Arrange the random colours based on the hue and visualise using specplot() library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  random_cols |>   arrange(luminance) |>   pull(hex) |>   specplot() random_cols |>   arrange(chroma) |>   pull(hex) |>   specplot() random_cols |>   arrange(hue) |>   pull(hex) |>   specplot()

title: Create a data frame of colour values — colour_data
code: colour_data("red") #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>   name  hex       hue chroma luminance   red green  blue #>   <chr> <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl> <int> <int> <int> #> 1 red   #FF0000  12.2   179.      53.2   255     0     0
